definitions.definition: an accepted principle or instruction that states the way things are or should be done, and tells you what you are allowed or are not allowed to do:
examples: A referee must know all the rules of the game.

definitions.definition: to control or be the person in charge of something such as a country:
examples: Most modern kings and queens rule (their countries) only in a formal way, without real power.

definitions.definition: to be the most important and controlling influence on someone:
examples: Love ruled supreme in her heart.
